claim: Define target audience, pain points, and value proposition before channels or pricing.
rationale: Assumption-led launches waste resources and erode trust; validation ensures real problems are solved.

claim: Choose GTM model by product complexity and sales cycle: PLG for self-serve, sales-led for complex/high-value, hybrid for mixed segments.
rationale: Mismatched models waste resources on wrong conversion mechanisms.

claim: Achieve LTV:CAC ≥ 3:1 before scaling GTM spend.
rationale: Scaling without solid unit economics burns capital without sustainable growth.

claim: Pilot programs de-risk GTM—test in controlled environments before full launch.
rationale: Pilots surface real-world challenges and refine product, messaging, and sales processes.

claim: Map the customer journey and optimize each touchpoint from awareness to post-purchase.
rationale: Stage-specific drop-offs reveal friction; tailored messaging/process improves conversion.

claim: Insufficient market research → product-market mismatch and wasted launches.
rationale: Assumption-driven GTM is the most common cause of failed launches.

claim: Siloed teams create inconsistent GTM and poor customer experience.
rationale: Lack of cross-functional alignment erodes trust and execution quality.

claim: Overlooking sales enablement cripples conversion; teams need training, collateral, demos, pricing clarity.
rationale: Strong product/marketing fail if sales cannot articulate value.

claim: Rigid GTM plans fail in dynamic markets; GTM must adapt to feedback and competitors.
rationale: Markets evolve; fixed plans underperform against changing preferences and moves.

claim: Product-Led Growth works when users can self-serve and experience value immediately via free/freemium.
rationale: Low barrier, intuitive onboarding, and viral loops make the product the primary GTM engine.

claim: Slack PLG: free teams spread internally; sales engages leadership after champions emerge.
rationale: Bottom-up adoption reduced CAC and accelerated enterprise deals.

claim: Peloton GTM: premium hardware + subscription, DTC channels, aspirational community marketing.
rationale: Sold a lifestyle; positioning and channel strategy drove loyalty and disruption.

claim: Warby Parker Home Try-On removed online eyewear objections; transparent pricing + social impact messaging.
rationale: Solved key purchase barrier; ethical narrative disrupted incumbents.

claim: Tesla DTC bypassed dealerships, controlling purchase-to-service experience.
rationale: Direct sales eliminated markups, aligned with premium education-first positioning.

claim: Use ABM for high-value enterprise deals—accounts as markets of one with multi-stakeholder personalization.
rationale: Targeted resources and tailored messaging improve close rates in complex committees.
